sentences.sContent: I had to break a window to get into the house.
sentences.sCn: 我只得打破一扇窗户进屋。

sentences.sContent: ...The one that used to get me was that swans could break your leg when they blow of the wing...
...its corporate culture was too rooted in the successes of the past for it to make the clean break necessary to fullyembrace the future...
...its corporate culture was too rooted in the successes of the past for it to make the clean break necessary to fully embrace the future...
...has examined how the returns on education break down for individuals with different backgrounds and levels of ability...
...when you break a role or law...
...and none of the institutions believe they can sustain the risks of trying to break away by themselves...
...I’m on a scheme that’s called phased retirement; I had a six-month break from work...

synos.tran: 打破，弄破；中断；弄坏；削弱

phrases.pCn: 打碎，破碎；结束；解散；衰落
分解；发生故障；失败；毁掉；制服
打断；闯入；训练；使逐渐习惯
v. 结束；与…绝交，和…断绝关系；和…决裂
断裂伸长；断裂延伸率；破坏时伸长量

words.tran: 易碎的东西，易破的东西
折断；打碎；损坏（break的过去分词）

trans.tranOther: if you break something, you make it separate into two or more pieces, for example by hitting it, dropping it, or bending it
